content:
• Friday, November 18, 2011
  • ETN

    Cooper Industries (CBE) will replace Janus Capital Group (NYSE:JNS) in the S&P 500 index...

    Cooper Industries (CBE) will replace Janus Capital Group (NYSE:JNS) in the S&P 500 index after the close of trading next Tuesday. CBE +7.40%, JNS +0.50% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM
  • WTSL

    Wet Seal (WTSLA) opened right at its 52-week low today, but closed trading with a 5.8% gain,...

    Wet Seal (WTSLA) opened right at its 52-week low today, but closed trading with a 5.8% gain, after the market decided its FQ3 report wasn't bad enough to warrant further bloodshed. Revenue of $152.1M missed by $5.6M, but EPS of $0.05 (exc. non-cash charges) beat by a penny. The company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $166M-$168M, below a consensus of $173.4M. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • CRM

    Several cloud software names moved lower today in the wake of industry leader's Salesforce.com...

    Several cloud software names moved lower today in the wake of industry leader's Salesforce.com (CRM -10%) FQ3 report. CTCT -6.3%. OTC:TNGO -4.2%. N -3.7%. SFSF -4.4%. TLEO -2.5%. (more on CRM)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCSC

    Country Style Cooking Restaurant Chain (CCSC -12.2%) became the latest Chinese ADR to tumble...

    Country Style Cooking Restaurant Chain (CCSC -12.2%) became the latest Chinese ADR to tumble after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $45.5M (+39% Y/Y) beat by $0.5M, EPS of $0.11 missed by a penny. In addition, the company is guiding for Q4 revenue of $42.3M-$43.9M, below a consensus of $46.8M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • CPWM

    Cost Plus (CPWM +3.5%) finishes higher after beating Q3 estimates earlier today. Net sales...

    Cost Plus (CPWM +3.5%) finishes higher after beating Q3 estimates earlier today. Net sales increased 3.7% Y/Y, while same store sales increased 8.8% Y/Y. The company also guided to the high end of estimates for Q4, with sales of $354M - $360M versus analysts' estimates of $355M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • MYRX

    Biotech developer Myrexis (OTC:MYRX +1.2%) bucks a weak tape to close higher after it announces...

    Biotech developer Myrexis (OTC:MYRX +1.2%) bucks a weak tape to close higher after it announces plans to reduce its workforce by 20% in its second restructuring this year, a move prompted by its September suspension of the development of then-lead drug candidate Azixa.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • PERY

    SunTrust sees no near-term catalyst to drive interest in Perry Ellis (PERY -8.5%) shares,...

    SunTrust sees no near-term catalyst to drive interest in Perry Ellis (PERY -8.5%) shares, lowering its rating to Neutral from Buy. Q3 results for the clothing maker's Rafaella category "no doubt remind many of prior acquisitions in the women's space that missed badly once folded in," SunTrust says, noting that it expects the brand to weigh on Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • MKGAY

    ADRs of German chemical and pharmaceutical maker Merck KGaA (OTCPK:MKGAY +0.7%) get a lift after...

    ADRs of German chemical and pharmaceutical maker Merck KGaA (OTCPK:MKGAY +0.7%) get a lift after receiving a positive opinion from a committee of the European Medicines Agency for its application to extend the indication of Rebif, its leading treatment for relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • CRM

    Though many analysts are defending Salesforce.com (CRM -10.9%) following yesterday's FQ3 report...

    Though many analysts are defending Salesforce.com (CRM -10.9%) following yesterday's FQ3 report (I, II), JPMorgan's John DiFucci isn't one of them, lowering his PT to $115 in a report titled "Slowing Business Momentum." DiFucci, who asked a pointed question during Salesforce's earnings call, is concerned about the fact new subscription billings growth dropped to just 12% Y/Y, well below a 34% consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • TALO

    Stone Energy (SGY +1.5%) trades higher after saying it's acquired a significant deep-water...

    Stone Energy (SGY +1.5%) trades higher after saying it's acquired a significant deep-water working interest in the Pompano Field in Mississippi from BP for $204M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • DVA

    Dialysis clinic operator DaVita (DVA +3.1%) signs a new, seven-year agreement to receive Amgen's...

    Dialysis clinic operator DaVita (DVA +3.1%) signs a new, seven-year agreement to receive Amgen's (AMGN -0.5%) anti-anemia drug Epogen. In an SEC filing, Amgen discloses that the Epogen it supplies will meet at least 90% of DaVita's requirements for erythropoiesis stimulating agents in clinics in the U.S. and Puerto Rico.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • CTAS

    Cintas (CTAS +1.5%) gains on a Citigroup upgrade to Buy, citing expectations for steady growth...

    Cintas (CTAS +1.5%) gains on a Citigroup upgrade to Buy, citing expectations for steady growth and improving margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • CME

    Fears of CME's (CME +4.9%) liabilities stemming from MF Global's meltdown seem to calm a bit...

    Fears of CME's (CME +4.9%) liabilities stemming from MF Global's meltdown seem to calm a bit after Evercore suggests limited fallout. Legal exposure looks "low," though CME likely will see increased legal costs and stricter regulations down the line, and trading volumes could be affected. But given the stock's pullback, Evercore thinks much of this is already priced in.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • DCI

    Donaldson (DCI +0.8%) gains after Jefferies raises estimates on the company following its latest...

    Donaldson (DCI +0.8%) gains after Jefferies raises estimates on the company following its latest earnings report, saying its engine segment continues to gain momentum and overall execution remains top tier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVX

    More bad news for Chevron (CVX -1.7%): A Brazilian state environment minister says the company's...

    More bad news for Chevron (CVX -1.7%): A Brazilian state environment minister says the company's oil spill could be "much bigger" than previously estimated, lending credence to existing fears, and the country's Federal Police claims Chevron "drilled about 500 meters farther than they were licensed to."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • MENT

    Mentor Graphics (MENT +13.8%) shares surge after the chip-design software company's FQ3 profit...

    Mentor Graphics (MENT +13.8%) shares surge after the chip-design software company's FQ3 profit rose a higher-than-expected 58%, benefiting from growing revenue and bookings. EPS was $0.25 on sales of $250M, beating analyst consensus of $0.21 and $245M; the company expects to add another $316M in sales in FQ4, reaching annual revenue of more than $1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • MTSC

    MTS Systems (NASDAQ:MTSC), a maker of industrial testing gear and position sensors, gains 10.9%...

    MTS Systems (NASDAQ:MTSC), a maker of industrial testing gear and position sensors, gains 10.9% after reporting FQ4 revenue of $131.6M (+24% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.94, trouncing Street estimates by $17.7M and $0.28. Moreover, the company is guiding for FY12 revenue and EPS growth in the "low double digit range," better than a consensus for slight revenue and EPS declines.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -20.4%) is considering whether to skip a $237M debt payment due Dec. 1, WSJ...

    Clearwire (CLWR -20.4%) is considering whether to skip a $237M debt payment due Dec. 1, WSJ reports. With $698M in cash and short-term investments as of Sept. 30, Clearwire can afford to pay, but the company needs to raise lots of money if it is to stay in business after the next 12 months, so it's debating the unusual step of failing to make a payment. S -3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBCN

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN -1.2%) dip after Goldman initiates coverage with a Sell...

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN -1.2%) dip after Goldman initiates coverage with a Sell rating, saying the company is faced with significant oversupply and pricing risks, plus high capital expenditures.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • AMZN

    As Amazon (AMZN -2.9%) shares near three-month lows, one factor could involve some negative...

    As Amazon (AMZN -2.9%) shares near three-month lows, one factor could involve some negative initial feedback from this week's Kindle Fire launch. Tech Crunch reports some users are suffering WiFi reception problems, with others saying the device shuts off its wireless when the display is turned off. No official word yet from Amazon, and it’s not clear how many devices are actually affected.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • SIRO

    Shares of Sirona Dental (SIRO -5.1%) are drilled after better-than-expected FQ4 results are...

    Shares of Sirona Dental (SIRO -5.1%) are drilled after better-than-expected FQ4 results are tempered by concerns of a possible slowdown in dental equipment orders. Profit fell by almost half Y/Y due to foreign exchange effects on international business, but excluding items, EPS was $0.68 and revenue totaled $218M, vs. analyst expectations of $0.61 and $214M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL +3.9%) and Royal Caribbean (RCL +2.7%) shares enjoy the ride after Jefferies...

    Carnival (CCL +3.9%) and Royal Caribbean (RCL +2.7%) shares enjoy the ride after Jefferies initiates coverage with Buy ratings for each, citing "a combination of low capacity growth and hence lower capex, proven cost control and demographics/value for money [that] will push ROIC above WACC for both companies.. not reflected in current share prices."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY -6.6%) takes on a downgrade from TheStreet.com to Hold from Buy, as analysts...

    Shutterfly (SFLY -6.6%) takes on a downgrade from TheStreet.com to Hold from Buy, as analysts with the firm cite "unimpressive growth in net income, disappointing return on equity and weak operating cash flow." Shares have been on a downward trend ever since Shutterfly's reported a Q3 loss, and are now threatening to reach a 52-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • GTATQ

    LED equipment maker GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -3.8%) dips after Canaccord intitiates the...

    LED equipment maker GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -3.8%) dips after Canaccord intitiates the stock with a lukewarm Hold rating, saying that current market expectations are in the process of being reset, making current guidance speculative at best.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • LEN

    Lennar (LEN -2.8%) takes a hit after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral on valuation. Citi says...

    Lennar (LEN -2.8%) takes a hit after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral on valuation. Citi says the stock has gotten ahead of its peers, having risen over 30% since late September, versus the homebuilder index which is up just 12% over the same period.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTOR

    KeyBanc downgrades Meritor (MTOR -6.4%) to Hold from Buy and suspends offering a price target on...

    KeyBanc downgrades Meritor (MTOR -6.4%) to Hold from Buy and suspends offering a price target on shares. Analysts with the firm cite the low-potential for near-term sales drivers and sees weaker global end markets for the company's products. Shares of MTORare now off 38% for the week after hitting a major speedbump with the firm's FQ4 report and FQ1 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • CHOP

    China Gerui Advanced Materials (CHOP +9.8%) pops after getting initiated with an Outperform at...

    China Gerui Advanced Materials (CHOP +9.8%) pops after getting initiated with an Outperform at Oppenheimer. The stock has been on a tear since early November, gaining nearly 60% in the wake of accusations it had been overstating earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • BSET

    Bassett Furniture Industries (BSET +1.3%) moves higher after declaring a special dividend of...

    Bassett Furniture Industries (BSET +1.3%) moves higher after declaring a special dividend of $0.50 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX +2.7%) jumps after its FQ2 beats across the board. The company also increases...

    Cyberonics (CYBX +2.7%) jumps after its FQ2 beats across the board. The company also increases its net sales guidance for FY12, now expecting to earn between $213M - $216M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • HOTT

    Clothing retailer Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT), which posted FQ2 results earlier this week, is up...

    Clothing retailer Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT), which posted FQ2 results earlier this week, is up 3.3% after Roth's Elizabeth Pierce upgrades shares to Buy. Pierce expects The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn, which opens in theaters today, to boost demand for Hot Topic's merchandise. Breaking Dawn currently sports an IMDB rating of 3.8/10.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • CMEDQ

    Medical device supplier China Medical Technologies (CMED +14.8%), which closed near its 52-week...

    Medical device supplier China Medical Technologies (CMED +14.8%), which closed near its 52-week low yesterday, shoots higher after reporting FQ2 revenue of $37.4M (+18% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.53; the former missed by $0.4M, but the latter beat by $0.04. In addition, the company is guiding for FY12 EPS of $1.94-$1.98, above a Street forecast of $1.81.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +3.8%) trades higher after Credit Suisse ups the shares to Outperform and...

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +3.8%) trades higher after Credit Suisse ups the shares to Outperform and raises its price target to $29. The firm says elements are in place for the company to achieve 15% pork export growth through 2013, as U.S. pork supply struggles to keep pace with rising hog prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • REGN

    More on Regeneron/Avastin: Though the FDA's decision is a positive for Regeneron (REGN -2.1%),...

    More on Regeneron/Avastin: Though the FDA's decision is a positive for Regeneron (REGN -2.1%), which offers its costlier Eylea drug as an alternative to Roche's (RHHBY.PK +0.9%) Avastin, many saw the decision coming, given prior news (I, II). In addition, investors may be focusing on the FDA's remarks (.pdf) about Avastin possibly being reapproved in the future, following new trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • CF

    Fertilizer stocks are bouncing back big from yesterday's drubbing spurred by talk of cheaper...

    Fertilizer stocks are bouncing back big from yesterday's drubbing spurred by talk of cheaper Ukranian natural gas and a decline in corn futures. Sensing new-found bargains, Lazard initiates coverage of the industry with a bullish outlook, citing potentially higher prices in nitrogen and potash. CF +4.5%, MOS +4.3%, POT +2.5%, AGU +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • ACHN

    Shares of Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +4.1%) bounce after CEO Michael Kishbauch confirms the...

    Shares of Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +4.1%) bounce after CEO Michael Kishbauch confirms the company is in talks with potential buyers or partners. He says licensing deals, asset sales, or selling the entire company are all on the table.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • FLS

    Flowserve (FLS +2.3%) gains after Wedbush initiates it with an Outperform. Wedbush says the...

    Flowserve (FLS +2.3%) gains after Wedbush initiates it with an Outperform. Wedbush says the company's build-out of its high margin after-market platform is creating a more steady growth profile, and should provide solid EPS growth over the next few years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ESE

    ESCO Technologies (ESE -2.3%) trades lower after BB&T downgrades the stock to Hold from Buy...

    ESCO Technologies (ESE -2.3%) trades lower after BB&T downgrades the stock to Hold from Buy on valuation, citing weak growth prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • REGN

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -1.5%) take an immediate dive lower from positive...

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -1.5%) take an immediate dive lower from positive territory after the FDA slams the lid on accelerated approval for Avastin.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CEDC

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -9.7%) dips on a pair of downgrades: Credit Suisse cuts the...

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -9.7%) dips on a pair of downgrades: Credit Suisse cuts the shares to Outperform, and Nomura reduces its rating to Hold. Both firms cite the company's weak Q3 and an overall lack of catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • MFRM

    Bedding retailer Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM), which priced its IPO at $19 last night, opened for...

    Bedding retailer Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM), which priced its IPO at $19 last night, opened for trading at $21.55 a short while ago. Shares are currently changing hands at $22.15, good for a 16.6% gain. (S-1 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (SIRI +4.3%) gets a lift from Lazard's Barton Crockett, who's upgrading shares to Buy...

    Sirius XM (SIRI +4.3%) gets a lift from Lazard's Barton Crockett, who's upgrading shares to Buy and setting a $2.25 PT. Crockett calls Sirius "an unusually resilient growth story," and expects an upcoming rate hike and cost cuts to boost profits. He also thinks stock buybacks could produce further upside. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • XCO

    Stifel Nicolaus steps up to downgrade Exco Resources (XCO -3.8%) to Hold following the company's...

    Stifel Nicolaus steps up to downgrade Exco Resources (XCO -3.8%) to Hold following the company's cuts to its FY12 capex budget.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • DLB

    Dolby (DLB +14.9%) surges after reporting FQ4 revenue of $243.8M and EPS of $0.81, trouncing...

    Dolby (DLB +14.9%) surges after reporting FQ4 revenue of $243.8M and EPS of $0.81, trouncing Street estimates by $13.4M and $0.15. Though the audio technology kingpin is guiding for FY12 revenue of just $910M-$970M ($982.3M consenus), its FY12 EPS guidance of $2.71-$3.02 is in-line with a $2.92 consensus. Dolby shares were down 58% on the year heading into earnings. (FQ3 report) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • DOLE

    Shares of Dole Foods (DOLE -7.8%) turn lower after recording a wider Q3 loss than expected on...

    Shares of Dole Foods (DOLE -7.8%) turn lower after recording a wider Q3 loss than expected on higher costs and a slumping fruit market in Europe. The firm's 5% Y/Y gain in revenue wasn't nearly enough to offset its rising expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ +2.7%) is trading higher after the appointment of an activist shareholder to its board,...

    H-P (HPQ +2.7%) is trading higher after the appointment of an activist shareholder to its board, and an upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee. While expecting H-P to lower its FY12 EPS guidance to the $4.30-$4.40 range ($4.60 consensus) during Monday's FQ4 report, Sterne Agee thinks this is better than many investors fear, and would imply shares trade at just 5-6x calendar 2012 EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • CRMT

    America's Car-Mart (CRMT +6.9%) jumps higher after its Q3 revenue increased 21% Y/Y and it saw...

    America's Car-Mart (CRMT +6.9%) jumps higher after its Q3 revenue increased 21% Y/Y and it saw an improvement in credit losses. The automotive retailers says that looking beyond FY12, it has plans to continue to open new dealerships at a 10% annual rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (CRM -9.6%) remains sharply lower post-earnings, as its FQ3 beat and healthy...

    Salesforce.com (CRM -9.6%) remains sharply lower post-earnings, as its FQ3 beat and healthy revenue guidance get offset by so-so EPS guidance (the result of aggressive spending) and soft billings and deferred revenue figures. Goldman, Deutsche, and Jefferies are staying bullish, with Jefferies noting management's CC comments about expecting strong deferred revenue growth in FQ4.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • HIBB

    Hibbett Sports (NASDAQ:HIBB) +7.1% premarket after reporting FQ3 earnings jumped a...

    Hibbett Sports (NASDAQ:HIBB) +7.1% premarket after reporting FQ3 earnings jumped a better-than-expected 27% Y/Y, as the sporting goods retailer strengthened margins and recorded its eighth straight quarter of higher same-store sales. For the quarter, EPS was $0.59 on $185M in revenue, vs. $0.51 and $180M consensus. For FY2012, Hibbett now expects EPS of $2.05-$2.11.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • KHC

    Shares of Heinz (HNZ) shed 2.8% premarket after the firm posts worse-than-expected FQ2 revenue....

    Shares of Heinz (HNZ) shed 2.8% premarket after the firm posts worse-than-expected FQ2 revenue. The company says it expects to close another three factories worldwide due to a "difficult environment." After factoring in productivity initiatives, Heinz reaffirms FY12 EPS in a range of $3.24-$3.32.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • PERY

    Needham weighs in on Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) after its shares cratered yesterday, down 36%,...

    Needham weighs in on Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) after its shares cratered yesterday, down 36%, following the retailer's Q3 earnings miss and lowered FY12 guidance. Analysts with the firm keep a Buy rating in place and reduce their PT on shares to $18 from $34 following the bloodbath - with a positive tone: "We think PERY should trade at least in-line with the low-end of a conservative long term growth rate of 8% to 10% as we expect to see sales and EBITDA improve in 2012." Shares +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • FMCN

    Shares of Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) run up a 13.8% gain premarket following an earnings beat as...

    Shares of Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) run up a 13.8% gain premarket following an earnings beat as it posted growth in its LCD display, in-store and poster frame segments. The company sees Q4 revenue growing to $212M-$214M with the mid-point of the range repping Y/Y growth of 45% and Q/Q growth of 9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • OZM

    Shares of Och-Ziff (NYSE:OZM) fall 3.8% premarket after the firm prices its $250M public...

    Shares of Och-Ziff (NYSE:OZM) fall 3.8% premarket after the firm prices its $250M public offering of shares at $7.50/share. The company says it will use proceeds from the offering to retire debt at a discount.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • ANN

    Shares of AnnTaylor (NYSE:ANN) gain 5.5% premarket after the company says it expects FY11...

    Shares of AnnTaylor (NYSE:ANN) gain 5.5% premarket after the company says it expects FY11 revenue to be $2.225B on comparable-store sales in the mid-single digits. The specialty retailer also says it anticipates ending the fiscal year with an increase in total inventory per square foot in the mid-single digits.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • ARUN

    Enterprise Wi-Fi gear vendor Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN), which fell 9.7% during yesterday's...

    Enterprise Wi-Fi gear vendor Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN), which fell 9.7% during yesterday's selloff, is up 5.6% after posting FQ1 results that weren't as bad as the market feared, and guiding on its earnings call for FQ2 revenue of $124M-$126M and EPS of $0.15 (consensus of $122.5M and $0.15). Aruba is also announcing the acquisition of Avenda Networks, a provider of Wi-Fi security solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM
  • BCSI

    Web security provider Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI) beats estimates with its FQ2 earnings...

    Web security provider Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI) beats estimates with its FQ2 earnings report and issues FQ3 EPS guidance well-above the consensus of analysts. The company is making a transition away from a reliance on sales to the U.S. government which have fallen off sharply Y/Y. Shares +20.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • CREE

    Goldman is launching coverage on Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) and Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) with Buy...

    Goldman is launching coverage on Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) and Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) with Buy ratings. The firm touts Cree's superior technology for the LED lighting market relative to the commoditized offerings of rivals, and believes adoption of Universal Display's OLED display technology is at an early stage. LED wafer maker Rubicon Technology is being started with a Sell. CREE +5.7%. PANL +4.8%.(previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM
  • XCO

    Shares of Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO) fall 9.5% in premarket trading after the firm announces its...

    Shares of Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO) fall 9.5% in premarket trading after the firm announces its 2012 capital budget. The company plans to cut capital spending by around 30% as it aims to reduce its net production of natural gas. "This capital budget reflects a continued increase in our Marcellus shale activities and a decrease in our Haynesville shale activities to a level we believe is appropriate."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM

  • European shares open down, with the debt crisis again pulling stocks lower as Spanish 10-year...

    European shares open down, with the debt crisis again pulling stocks lower as Spanish 10-year bond yields climb 35 bps to 6.8%. Euro STOXX 50 -0.5%, London -0.7%, Paris -0.7%, Frankfurt -0.7%, Milan -0.2%, Madrid -0.2%. STOXX Europe 600 Banks index -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 AM
